title:
Inspired by K-pop, Indonesian star search spurs business deal -
                        Nikkei Asia
text: Local group CT enlists South Korea's SM Entertainment in hopes of global break JAKARTA -- With help from one of South Korea's largest entertainment companies, Indonesian conglomerate CT Corp. aims to draw on a young, growing population of music fans to create a homegrown version of K-pop. Trans Media, an arm of the Indonesian group, recently signed a deal with SM Entertainment that could pave the way for Indonesian artists to gain international fans -- something with which they have struggled. Discover the all new Nikkei Asia app Nikkei Asian Review, now known as Nikkei Asia, will be the voice of the Asian Century.
